Description: Oval clay game-piece made from a recut sherd of pottery.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 9, very probably
Curator's comments: One of the "draughtmen made of rounded chips of pottery in chamber 9" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 71, found with gaming-board London, BM, EA 23802, and game-pieces London, BM, EA 23836, 23837, 23838.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 71)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.87, p.188, pl.30)
